title: Vivera 2012 Martinella Rosso  (Etna)
description: Made with 90% Nerello Mascalese and 10% Nerello Cappuccio, this has aromas suggesting scorched earth, brimstone, charcuterie and dried Mediterranean herb. On the linear palate, hints of licorice, clove and a smoky note accent a core of dried black cherry. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2022.

title: Volver 2014 Triga Red (Alicante)
description: A blast of chocolate and mocha rises up on this heavily oaked Monastrell and Cabernet blend before those aromas change to char and toast. A chewy, heavyweight palate deals flavors of licorice, blackened oak and char along with dark fruit that's more canvas than paint. Drink this modern red with steak or roast lamb and it will show best.

title: Voyager Estate 2012 Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: This is a delicate, light Chardonnay with age is on its side. Ripe red apples, melon, vanilla and some toasty oak aromas lead into a more floral and citrus palate. There's a good lick of acidity but it's relatively in balance with some textural weight. Still tightly wound, there're plenty more years left. Drink now–2027.

title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2016 Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Glazes of honey and caramelized sugar lend sweetness to unctuous guava and white peach throughout this fruity, forward spätlese. Racy lemon-lime acidity lends keen balance on the palate, extending a citrusy freshness to the finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 AVA Series Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: The AVA Series comprises small-production, single vineyard wines that showcase specific Willamette Valley terroirs. This one, sourced from the outstanding Alloro vineyard, is a delicious mix of red fruit, charred wood, caramel and sea salt. The 30% new oak is right up front—toasty and quite tasty.

title: William Rose 2016 Dry Riesling (Oregon)
description: Dry as indicated, with substantial alcohol for a Riesling, this is a tart and juicy explosion of Meyer lemon, grapefruit and pineapple fruit. There's a succulent snap to the finish, which ties in just a hint of residual sugar to round it off a touch.

title: Woodlands 2014 Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Margaret River)
description: Cherry chocolate cake, mint, and beef jerky make up the primary aromas on this red blend from one of Margaret River's top producers. The palate is medium bodied, with dusty, drying yet elegant tannins and a salt and cherry finish. Drink now.

title: Birichino 2015 Old Vines Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light on the nose, this bottling from 37-year-old vines shows squeezed lemon wedge, chilled Asian pear, hints of jicama and white rose petals on the nose. The citrusy palate is driven by a grapefruit pith flavor and enhanced with a touch of chalk. The texture is compellingly grippy.

title: Birichino 2015 Saint Georges Old Vines Zinfandel (Central Coast)
description: Fresh and broad aromas of strawberry and red currant meet with peppercorns and crushed oregano on the nose of this bottling of old-vine Zin from southern Santa Clara County. It's a lighter style on the palate, with bright red plums, crushed river rock and a good helping of herb flavors.

title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Adrianna Vineyard Mundus Bacillus Terrae Malbec (Tupungato)
description: This richly oaked selection from the high-elevation Adrianna Vineyard in Tupungato smells of berries, red currants and maple. It's angular on the palate, with acidity so high it's downright citric. Red berry, red plum and wood grain are the dominant flavors, and they're tarter than they are lush. Tannin is a noticeable element on its otherwise racy, high-acid finish. Drink through 2035.

title: Al-Cantàra 2014 Luci Luci Bianco  (Etna)
description: This golden-hued wine opens with aromas suggesting beeswax, Spanish broom and orchard fruit. The subdued, refined palate offers creamy yellow apple, pear, citrus and a hint of paraffin. A mineral note accents the finish.

title: Aljibes 2016 Viña Aljibes Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Meaty blackberry aromas smell of soy sauce and game. A widespread palate comes with grabby tannins. Mint, oak and herbal berry fruit flavors are more sauvage than polished, while this blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet and Petit Verdot is tight on the finish, with rugged residual tannins. Drink through 2022.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Altocedro 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)
description: Altocedro likes to pile on the creamy oak, and this Malbec has that in spades. Wood spice and lacquer aromas weigh down its blueberry, blackberry and green scents. Chunky weight and creamy oak define the palate, as do burnt wood, resin and grassy berry flavors.

title: Artadi 2013 Pasos de San Martín Garnacha (Navarra)
description: This spicy, fiery smelling Garnacha shows bright plum and berry aromas. In the mouth, this is tough and tannic, with raw acidity and a mild burn. Dark, spicy berry flavors are blackened, while this tastes peppery and feels hot on the finish.

title: Bells Up 2014 Titan Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This pleasant wine is aging rather quickly, already a light rose hue with early bricking. It's in its prime drinking window, with sour cherry and plum flavors and hints of stem and bitter herb, all in proportion. Drink now through 2022.

title: Domaine Jacques Girardin 2015 Maladière Premer Cru  (Santenay)
description: The Maladière vineyard has given a structured wine full of dark tannins and concentrated black fruit. With acidity to match and a dry core, it is a rich wine with considerable potential. Drink from 2022.

title: Dúzsi Tamás NV Kékfrankos Rosé (Szekszárd)
description: This salmon-pink rosé is made from Kékfrankos (Blaufränkisch) and has aromas of raspberry, strawberry and white peach. Red fruit flavors continue on the palate, detailing strawberry and plum, before a light, gentle finish.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2016 Schie fer Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Honeyed tangerine and yellow peach accent exotic spice throughout this zippy dry Riesling. It's a pleasantly tart, briskly textured wine, highlighted by layers of lime and lemon acidity. Drink now through 2021.

title: Iris Vineyards 2015 Arete Chalice Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This reserve level Iris Vineyards wine gets a special name and faux wax capsule, along with time in new oak. It's then blended and aged in a neutral puncheon, making it soft and easy-drinking, its spicy pear and peach fruit swathed in a light mix of butter, caramel and toast. Give it a slight chill and drink now through 2021.

title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2016 Vieilles Vignes de Sainte Claire  (Chablis)
description: This soft, creamy wine comes from old vines close to the Brocard winery. It has the proper crispness and citrus character of the vintage plus riper yellow fruits and melon. Drink this attractive wine from late 2018.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Piesporter Michelsberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Fresh lemon and bramble notes on the nose open to plush white peach and honey in this straightforward yet irresistible auslese. This is both ample in fruit yet briskly balanced. The finish is long and sweet, edged by a hint of caramel.

title: Leto 2013 The Hidden One Old Vine Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Thick and dusty in cedar and a touch of smoke, this robustly ripe wine leans into thickets of brambly black currant and blackberry dipped in chocolate.

title: Louis Jadot 2015  Chassagne-Montrachet
description: This village wine comes from a number of growers who supply Jadot on a regular basis. It is bold and ripe with citrus and white stone fruits as well as plenty of acidity. Its rounded character will show more strongly as it ages. Drink from 2020.

title: Louis Jadot 2015  Ladoix
description: The vines of Ladoix are at the base of the Corton hill but much less well known and therefore better value. Juicy acidity and the core of tannin suggest a wine that is ageworthy, while the black-plum fruits give richness now. Drink from 2019.

title: Louis Michel 2016  Chablis
description: This is a well-balanced wine with crisp acidity, steely texture and delicious citrus fruits. It has a bright, lively texture and will be ready to drink from summer 2018.

title: Margerum 2016 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The nose on this sleek bottling by Doug Margerum manages to combines both the grape's telltale grassy tones and tightly reductive qualities with fresh passion fruit and kiwi flavors. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where lime skin and white rock flavors shine.

title: Mastroberardino 2016 Morabianca Falanghina (Irpinia)
description: Made with selected grapes from a single vineyard, this opens with alluring aromas of white stone fruit, tropical fruit, pressed wildflower and a hint of toasted almond. The fresh, tangy palate offers white peach, citrus and green melon alongside crisp acidity.

title: Mastroberardino 2016 NovaSerra  (Greco di Tufo)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit and spring flower lead the nose while the bright palate delivers green apple, Bartlett pear and citrus alongside a steely mineral note. It finishes clean and crisp.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is extremely subtle, with hints of stone fruit and citrus. The palate is extremely crisp and clean, with Asian pear, lime peel and hints of oak smoke. The focus is tightly wound texture more than overt flavors.

title: Peltier 2016 Black Diamond Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Crisp and steely, this wine tastes absolutely fresh from the light herb and green-apple aroma to the lemon-lime flavors, lively acidity and clean snappy finish. It's light to medium in body, has good balance and an especially appetizing character.
